text: Strezinja (fl. 1075-1089) was an 11th-century župan of Bribir, and a known member of the Šubić noble family (later the Zrinski's). At one point, he is mentioned with a retinue of five knights, which indicates private armies in service of župan's.http://hbl.lzmk.hr/clanak.aspx?id=2807Florin Curta, Southeastern Europe in the Middle Ages, 500-1250 pp. 261 He was in a land dispute with the abbot of the Benedictine monastery of Saint John the Evangelist in the city of Biograd, which was eventually resolved by king Demetrius Zvonimir in Nin.https://hr.wikisource.org/wiki/Stranica:Vjekoslav_Klai%C4%87_Povjest_Hrvata.djvu/130 He is later mentioned as part of the retinue of king Stephen II. ==See also== *Šubić family tree ==References== ==External links== *http://www.matica.hr/hr/346/Zlatni%20vijek%20Bribira%20/ *Bribirski knezovi do konca 14 stoljeća Category:11th-century Croatian people Category:Medieval Croatian nobility
title: Strezinja, Župan of Bribir
